SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

datanetwork
Class DNConnection

java.lang.Object
  datanetwork.DNConnection

public class DNConnection
extends java.lang.Object

The SenseWorldDataNetwork Processing library offers a quick and easy way to retrieve or publish data from a SenseStageDataNetwork.

Part of Sense/Stage

OSC classes are based on Java OSC. Copyright (c) 2002-2006, C. Ramakrishnan / Illposed Software

The DNConnection sets up the incomming and outgoing connections to the server. Once connected to server, it is possible to send messages on the network using the methods provided in this class. To ensure the minimum chance of errors in communication this class also recieves all the messages from the server. From here it decides which ones should go through the Processing parent sketch and which ones should not. To recieve the messages in the Processing sketch, it needs to implement the dnEvent(OSCMessage msg) method.

Please look at the Processing examples provided in the example folders to see a basic implementation in a Processing sketch.

Version:
002
Author:
Vincent de Belleval (v@debelleval.com), Brett Bergmann

Constructor Detail

DNConnection

public DNConnection(processing.core.PApplet parent,
                    java.lang.String address,
                    int outgoing_port,
                    int incoming_port,
                    java.lang.String name)
Constructs a new DNConnection attatched to the specified PApplet. This is the only available constructor available even if some of the arguments are optional in an attempt to enforce good practices.

Parameters:
parent - the Processing PAapplet to which the DNConnection is attached.
address - the IP address of the server to attempt to connect to.
outgoing_port - the port the sever at the specified address is listening to. It is possible to query this port on the server getServerPort(String addy) directly from the constructor.
incoming_port - the port DNConnection will listen to for incomming messages from the server.
name - the name the client will have on the network.
See Also:
getServerPort(String addy)
Method Detail

getServerPort

public static int getServerPort(java.lang.String serverAddress)
Fetches the port the SenseWorldDataNetwork server is listening to (see the SenseWorldDataNetwork documentation for more details). Can be called directly from the DNConnection constructor.

Parameters:
serverAddress - the server's IP address.

oscEvent

public void oscEvent(OSCMessage message)
Not to be called directly by the user! Recieves all the messages from the server and routes them.

Parameters:
message - the recieved OSCMessage.

setVerbo

public void setVerbo(int level)
Sets the level of verbosity.
\t1 prints server errors.
2 prints server errors and warnings.
3 prints server errors, warnings and server replies to registration and subscription.
4 prints server errors, warnings, registration/substription replies and all client errors.
5 prints all of the above plus "ping" messages from the server.

Parameters:
level - the level of verbosity to be set.

getVerbo

public int getVerbo()
Returns the verbosity level.

Returns:
the current verbosity level.

isRegistered

public boolean isRegistered()
Returns whether or not the client has been registered on the server.

Returns:
true if the client is registered on the network.

Attempts to register the DNConnection to the network.

Attempts to unregister the DNConnection from the network.

subscribeSlot

public void subscribeSlot(int nodeId,
                          int[] slotId)
Allows to subscribe to multiple slots at once.

Parameters:
nodeId - the ID of the node that contains the slot to subscribe to.
slotId - the IDs of the slots to subscribe to.

unsubscribeSlot

                            int slotId)
Unubscribes from a specific slot on the network.

slotId - the ID of the slot to unsubscribe from.

getNode

public void getNode(int nodeId)
Asks a node for the data it contains. It does not return anything on its own. The data will be passed to the dnEvent method wiht the "/data/node" address.

Parameters:
nodeId - the ID of the node to query.

getSlot

public void getSlot(int nodeId,
                    int slotId)
Asks a slot for the data it contains. It does not return anything on its own. The data will be passed to the dnEvent method wiht the "/data/slot" address.

Parameters:
nodeId - the ID of the node which contains the slot to query.
slotId - the ID of the slot to query.

setData

public void setData(DNNode node,
                    float[] data)
Sets the slots of a node to the array of floats being passed. The client needs to be the setter of the node in order to set its data. The type of the node has to correspond with the right data type being passed to it.

Parameters:
node - the DNNode on which to set the data.
data - the array of floats that will fill the node's slots.
See Also:
DNNode

setData

public void setData(DNNode node,
                    java.lang.String[] data)
Sets the slots of a node to the array of Strings being passed. The client needs to be the setter of the node in order to set its data. The type of the node has to correspond with the right data type being passed to it.

Parameters:
node - the DNNode on which to set the data.
data - the array of Strings that will fill the node's slots.
See Also:
DNNode

removeNode

public void removeNode(DNNode node)
Removes a node from the network. Only possible if the client is the setter of the node.

Parameters:
node - the node to remove from the network.
See Also:
DNNode

removeAll

public void removeAll()
Removes all the nodes the client if a setter of from the network.

addExpected

public void addExpected(DNNode node)
Adds an expected node on the server. Can also be called after using DNNode.setType(int type) of a node have been changed to update it on the network. It might clear all its current data.

Parameters:
node - the node to add on the network.

addExpected

public void addExpected(DNNode[] nodes)
Adds or updates an array of nodes on the network.

Parameters:
nodes - the array of nodes to add on the network.
See Also:
DNNode

close

public void close()
Safely closes the DNConnection. It should be called from the stop() method in the PApplet. It will not remove the nodes the client is a setter of on the network. If you wish to do so, call removeAll() before this method.

See Also:
DNNode, removeAll()
